personal.name: Nedyalko Andreev
personal.title: Full-Stack Developer
personal.short_bio: A highly skilled generalist developer with more than 12 years of diverse work experience. Interested in security, devops, and data wrangling. Currently striving to master Rust and machine learning with Python. Seeking professional opportunities, especially to work on intriguing open source projects.

education.description: A diversified master's program at the Faculty of Mathematics and Informatics at Sofia University that focuses on designing, building, and interconnecting complex distributed systems. It also has a very wide range of optional courses on networking, security, and system architecture and administration. I have completed all necessary courses, but am yet to defend a thesis.

The diversity of the core course program is only exceeded by the abundance of quality optional courses, of which I took full advantage.

work.description: Occasional teaching and consulting/freelance engagements, mostly involving Go, CI/CD/DevOps and infrastructure security.

work.label: R&D Lead
work.name: Research and Development Lead
work.description: Lead several diverse projects, the biggest of which involved converting several dozen active SVN repos to git, introducing GitLab to the company, and securing and overhauling other key development infrastructure components and CI/CD processes.

skills.name: JavaScript

work.label: Project Manager
work.name: Project Manager
work.description: I lead a team of 6 people to build and launch iTrend - an innovative alternative to Avus Capital's main service trading212.com that was targeted at novice traders. Since the first half of 2013 was spent mostly hiring the team and iterating and testing the new product concepts, I still acted as an advisor and mentor to the new NetCredit team (the two companies had the same owners and shared an office).

work.label: Senior Web Developer
work.name: Senior Web Developer
work.description: I was the initial and later the lead developer of NetCredit - a website for short-term loans of small sums of money.

work.label: Freelancer
work.name: Freelance Web Developer
work.description: Development and maintenance of different web projects, mostly in the sphere of e-commerce and insurance.

work.label: Web Developer
work.name: Web Developer
work.description: Development and maintenance of different web projects, mostly e-commerce sites and ad management portals.

work.label: Web Developer
work.name: Web Developer
work.description: Developed a network of websites for sharing links to interesting internet resources, similar to digg.com at the time. All sites shared a common engine, functionality and database, but each one had its own design and content. The project was left unfinished because the company went bankrupt.

work.label: Web Developer
work.name: Web Developer
work.description: Maintained and improved different company web projects, including a system for unified user accounts and scoreboards across dozens of different multiplayer game servers (CS, ScarCraft, WarCraft 2 and 3, Diablo 2, etc.). I participated in the development of two entirely new projects - automated on-demand Xen virtual servers and headoff.mobi - an unsuccessful attempt to create a common country-wide network of wireless access points.

skills.name: Linux
skills.description: I've been a Linux user since 2008 and my main operating system since 2013 has been QubesOS (with an Arch Linux template). I also currently maintain a few pet linux servers for personal use.

projects.label: Go Course
projects.name: Golang Crash Course
projects.description: An intensive Go language course for some of the developers at Chaos Group.

projects.label: DevOps consultant
projects.name: DevOps & Infrastructure Security Consulting
projects.description:
I helped while the company restructured their infrastructure team. My responsibilities were:
  • Improving and securing some internal CI/CD processes.
  • Transitioning automation jobs from Jenkins to GitLab CI with Docker containers.
  • Preparing proof-of-concept solutions for integrated testing and production environments with different container management software. For instance, one PoC was using docker compose to run integration tests of complex interconnected applications. Another example was using Docker Cloud (and later Kubernetes on Google Cloud) to potentially run and manage multiple services in production).
  • Integrating LetsEncrypt to replace self-signed certificates in a lot of the CI infrastructure.
  • Helping with the dissemination of DevOps knowledge and the hiring of new people.
I also taught a short Golang crash course due to interested employees.

projects.label: nedomi
projects.name: nedomi
projects.description: nedomi is an open-source high performance HTTP reverse proxy that efficiently caches big files. It was written for a CDN service that specializes in delivering video content and was able to handle 6 Gbps of production traffic on one server.

projects.label: Golang Courses
projects.name: Golang University Courses
projects.description: I was one of the teachers in the last three additions of an elective Golang crouse at Sofia University's Faculty of Mathematics and Informatics.

projects.label: iTrend
projects.name: iTrend
projects.description: iTrend was an innovative alternative to Avus Capital's main service trading212.com. It offered a simpler and more visual trading experience and was targeted at novice users. I lead a team of 6 people to build and launch it.

projects.label: NetCredit
projects.name: NetCredit
projects.description: NetCredit is a service for short-term loans of small sums of money. Initially I was the only backend developer, and with one frontend developer and one designer we managed to launch the service from scratch in just 2 months. Later the team grew and I was the lead developer until Jan 2013 when I transitioned to iTrend, but remained an advisor and mentor until Sep that year.

skills.name: Data Wrangling
skills.description: I created a highly customizable BI system in the backend administrative interface. It could be used for searching, aggregating, exporting, and plotting arbitrary data directly in the application, without the need to use external tools.

projects.label: Xen VPSes
projects.name: Xen On-Demand Virtual Servers
projects.description: The cloud in 2006... sort of :). We made a system for automated on-demand customizable Xen servers. Just from our web interface you could create a new VM with custom resources, automatically install your preferred Linux distribution on it and have it running in a few minutes. After that you could log in via ssh or manage the VM entirely through the web interface. The billing was on a monthly basis, but that was a business decision - our freely-accessible online demo created a new test server on demand and automatically destroyed it in an hour.

projects.label: BitTorrent Tracker
projects.name: BitTorrent Tracker
projects.description: Learned PHP while developing a small torrent website and tracker for... let's go with "linux ISOs"...
